intro: Neurocarpum macrophyllum, commonly known as the giant water fern, is a unique aquatic plant characterized by its large, floating fronds. It belongs to the family Salviniales and is native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has a complex structure with a central rhizome that supports its broad, lobed leaves. Its fronds can grow up to several meters in length, making it one of the largest ferns in the world. Neurocarpum macrophyllum plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and oxygen.
